summary: "There was a shout from the courtyard below. Prince Tommen was rolling in the dust trying to get up and failing. All the padding...
caption: “There was a shout from the courtyard below. Prince Tommen was rolling in the dust trying to get up and failing. All the padding made him look like a turtle on it’s back. Bran was standing over him with upraised sword, ready to whack him again once he regained his feet. The men began to laugh.”

summary: Why is it that the current mentors of the young Starks (LF, The Faceless Men and Bloodraven), the ones meant to train them for...
question: Why is it that the current mentors of the young Starks (LF, The Faceless Men and Bloodraven), the ones meant to train them for their part in the endgame and beyond, are all shitty in some way? Their goals range from unjust at best to devastating at worst.
answer:
To be fair, Bloodraven’s on the right side of things, it’s just that his moral supervision of the child he’s training up to serious supernatural power is severely lacking. Uncle Ben he is not.

The answer, though, is conflict. 

If Littlefinger really did see Sansa as a daughter and only as a daughter, if he was sincere in his love for her and Catelyn, where’s Sansa’s internal conflict? Everything’s external: will Sansa regain Winterfell? Will she go North in time to meaningfully aid her family? She never has to ask herself who she is and who she wants to be. Ditto Arya, though it’s harder to see how she could learn those particular skills from morally above-board sources. Uh, say she was learning fighting from some old soldiers and moonlighting with mummers, go with that. If she did that, she never has to ask herself who she is and who she wants to be, either, and again the conflict would be coming only from external factors. And Bran - without going the wrong way, his powers turn into a supernatural slugfest, rather than an examination of the responsibility that comes with that power.

summary:
Bran: Larry got out so now we have to give him cat anitbiotics every day at noon.
Jojen: We've both been coming home at lunch...
body:
Bran: Larry got out so now we have to give him cat anitbiotics every day at noon.
Jojen: We've both been coming home at lunch because it's a two man job.
Bran: As is the other activity we've been enjoying... -*eyes Jojen*- you look really good in that suit.
Jojen: -*eyes him*- 
Bran: Only eight more days of cat antibiotics.
Jojen: Say antibiotics one more time. 
Bran: Antibiotics.
Jojen: -*jumps in the wheelchair and starts kissing him.*-

summary: Benjen Stark was totally wasted in episode 7x06, his appearance really could have been something interesting. They could have...
body:
Benjen Stark was totally wasted in episode 7x06, his appearance really could have been something interesting. They could have had him meet with them beyond the wall, maybe go full Coldhands and have him with a flock of crows (you know, maybe the ones we’ve seen Bran bouncing between). He could have guided them AND he could have pointed out how dumb it was that they didn’t BRING HORSES ON A RANGING MISSION BEYOND THE WALL

He’s been living beyond the wall for years and could have given them information about the others, that they then could have taken to the dumb meeting in the Dragon Pit, he also could have given Jon an update on Bran.

It would have made much MUCH more sense to give Benjen the “you don’t look like your father line” as opposed to Beric because it A) would have actually have made sense that way and B) would have been something interesting for Jon to ponder over because he VERY MUCH LOOKS LIKE NED STARK and Beric knowing the truth, or claiming that Jon doesn’t look like him is some bullshit.

tags: as crônicas de gelo e fogo
summary: Os anos passam às centenas e aos milhares, e o que vê qualquer homem vivo além de alguns Verões e alguns Invernos? Olhamos as...
text: Os anos passam às centenas e aos milhares, e o que vê qualquer homem vivo além de alguns Verões e alguns Invernos? Olhamos as montanhas e dizemos que são eternas, e é o que parecem ser… Mas, no correr do tempo, montanhas erguem-se e ruem, rios mudam de curso, estrelas caem do céu, e grandes cidades afundam-se no mar. Pensamos que até os deuses morrem. Tudo muda. Talvez a magia um dia tenha sido uma força poderosa no mundo, mas já não o é. O pouco que resta não é mais do que o fiapo de fumaça que permanece no ar depois de um grande incêndio se extinguir, e até isso está se desvanecendo. Valíria foi a última brasa, e ela desapareceu. Já não há dragões, os gigantes estão mortos, e os filhos da floresta, esquecidos com todo o seu saber. Não, meu príncipe. Jojen Reed pode ter tido um sonho ou dois que acredita se tornaram verdade, mas não tem a visão verde. Nenhum homem vivo detém esse poder.
source: George R.R Martin - A Fúria dos Reis

reblog.comment: George R.R Martin - A Fúria dos Reis

summary: A queda, pensou Bran, e o homem dourado, o irmão da rainha, ele também me assusta, mas é principalmente a queda. Mas não disse....
text: A queda, pensou Bran, e o homem dourado, o irmão da rainha, ele também me assusta, mas é principalmente a queda. Mas não disse. Como poderia? Não tinha sido capaz de dizer a Sor Rodrik ou ao Meistre Luwin, e também não podia dizer aos Reed. Se não falasse no assunto, talvez o esquecesse. Nunca queria se lembrar. Podia até nem ser uma memória verdadeira.
source: George R.R Martin - A Fúria dos Reis

summary: Jaime’s redemption arc is REAL. Thank you Issac! Bran Stark truly knows all. Lol @ redemption deniers 😜
title: Jaime’s redemption arc is REAL. Thank you Issac! Bran Stark truly knows all. Lol @ redemption deniers 😜
body:
Ok, first insight from #ammd : Isaac said if he didnt play Bran, he would have liked to play Jaime and his redemption. 

source: https://twitter.com/guiltypleased/status/1033337164199804930

And there you have it! Issac knows what happens in season 8 so…..rabid Cersei stans who try to fool themselves and others into thinking Jaime is as bad as Cersei need to go back and reevaluate their lives.

tags: bran stark x plus size reader
brandon stark x plus size reader
game of thrones x plus size reader
game of thrones x ps reader
title: Love Her
body:
Bran Stark x Plus size!reader

Word Count: 2061 words (Long) 

Warnings: none? 

Summary: A different take on how being betrothed to Bran would go. The two of you have been friends for quite some time. He has his accident and tries to shut her out but she won’t let her. 

———————————————————————————————————

You had just heard of the accident your dear friend had been in, and you were on your way to speak to him.

As soon as you opened the door to his chamber you were stopped by his mother Lady Catelyn.

“You, you did this to poor Bran” She yelled, instantly making you frown. “How milady? I was only riding with Sansa and Robb” you defend, but she scowled at you none-the-less.

Catelyn couldn’t stop her hatred for you, no matter how hard she tried. “I want you to leave” she spits with anger and hate in her eyes. “I’m sorry milady, I didn’t mean to anger you” You apologized, quickly hurrying out of the room. On your way, down the hall you rushed into Robb, and didn’t even realize until he had you by the wrist, keeping you from the ground.

Of course it was bothersome for you, to have earned nothing but Lady Catelyn’s aggression regardless of how hard you tried to make her like you. “Why are you in such a hurry for, aren’t you going to see Bran?” he asked, almost forcing you to burst into tears.

“Lady Catelyn wont let me see him, she says its my fault he is hurt ” You blubbered, normally you tried to save face but with something like Bran at stake, there was no way to do so.

“Hush now” Robb whispered, pulling you into him. “It’s not your fault” he assured, hugging you into his chest as he tried his hardest to soothe you.

“Its not your fault” he repeated over and over before letting you up. It was crazy to him that his mother was willing to make you feel so guilty about something out of your control. “Come now, stay behind me and we shall see him, just stay quiet” he suggests, wrapping you simply in his cloak before leading you down the hall toward Bran’s room.

“Mother” you heard Robb bellow, before hearing only a whimper from Catelyn in reply.

“He is dead, that’s all they say, he is dead” She cries and you wince at the word “He isn’t” Robb assures her. You took this moment to peak through the fabric of his cloak, almost breaking down at the sight of your broken friend.

“Why are you angry with Y/N” He asked, hiding your tense at his name. “This is her fault” she spit, shutting down his words without so much as a breath. You would have run for the hills if she spoke to you that way, but Robb didn’t falter. “This has nothing to do with her” he reminded, his voice strong and commanding as he headed toward the door, with you on his heels.

“She truly does hate me” You frowned, as soon as you stopped in the hall. Robb shook his head again “She is only hurt because she worries for him, don’t take it personally” he assured you, sending you off to find Arya.

If anyone was going to help you feel better after such a problem, it would be Arya.

-

Bran had woken a few weeks ago and you were hardly prepared for the news that his awakening would bring.

“He cannot walk” Jon had informed you and you nearly choked “He cant walk” you repeated, making sure you heard him right. Robb nodded, letting you know that the sick joke was the truth. “Can I speak to him?” your voice was slight, and careful as you implored the answer to both men. “I will take you, you shouldn’t go alone” Robb nodded, taking your hand.

There was a good chance that even after all this time, Catelyn hadn’t gotten over her upset and he wasn’t going to throw you to the wolves alone. “Will you come too Bran?” you ask, earning an odd look from him. You and Jon had never been the closest but you needed all the support you could get right now.

When you all finally got to Bran’s room, he was leaning on his bed side. “Bran” you muttered, your words falling from your lips in a gasp, throwing yourself from the two men and onto the bed.

“You’re alive” you yelled, hugging him roughly, avoiding his legs but holding him tight in your arms. “Barely” he groaned, shrugging away from you quickly. It wasn’t for the sake of you, but he was ashamed.

He was less of a man now. He wanted to marry you and build a strong home to raise your children in but who would want a cripple?

“Bran?” you questioned, his behavior was odd and put you on edge. “I can’t walk, I’m a cripple…useless, I’d rather be dead” He barked, instantly earning a gasp from you. How dare he say something like that? You’d been through so much over the last few months while he was unconscious, and now he felt inclined enough to say something so brash.

“Don’t ever say that Bran, you aren’t a cripple, you survived” you assured, running your hand over the side of his face, letting your touch relax him ever so slightly. You simply looking in his eyes, even though he didn’t want to look in yours. “Leave me” he ordered and you frowned, but stepped off the bed anyway, past Jon and Robb out the door.

You wanted to support Bran but it didn’t mean anything if he didn’t want you to. Even you knew that much.

“What are you doing?” Robb yells toward Bran, the boy only looked at him blankly. Robb turned quickly to follow you, leaving Jon and Bran all alone.

“Can I talk to you Bran?” Jon asked, sitting beside his brother on the bed. The boy nodded, giving his brother as much of his attention as he could. “Do you understand why Y/N is here?” he asked, starting the conversation of simply.

Bran shook his head.

“Well, when the time comes, you will marry her and she will live here in the north with you” he explained, his attention poised on his brother “So she isn’t my friend?” he countered, not completely understanding what you were going with.

Jon chuckled, Bran really had no idea what was going on “She is but she is more than that, she is to be your wife, your lady” finally, Bran nodded. He’d heard of people being betrothed before, but never did he think about you in that compacity.

It took a few moments for the information to sink in and once it did, Bran had a secondary question. “And I will love her?” his words caught Jon off guard but he smiled at the boy none-the-less.

YEARS AFTER:

You have been living in Westeros for years now, and had since learned of your betrothal to Bran and even looked forward to the day you would marry your best friend.

It had taken quite some time to grasp how many things had to be done differently now that Bran couldn’t use his legs. However, your love for him expanded even his paralysis.

You rushed through the woods as Bran followed on horseback-chasing you, a game you’d started years ago.

“You can’t get me” you taunted, as he laughed. “I’m your lord, address me of such” he ordered, still chuckling as his horse jaunted down the path.  "You cant get me, my lord" you added, rushing past the large tree until your foot caught a loose branch.

You fell to the ground in a heap and only looked up to see Bran laughing at you from atop his horse.

“Are you alright?” he asked, suddenly wishing he could only hop down from his horse and help you up, cursing his condition. “I’m fine” you assure, standing and brushing yourself off, walking over to the stream to wipe the mud off your face.

“Would you like to come down my lord?” you ask, earning a quick nod from him. You stood to the side of the horse and went to work on the latches that held Bran’s legs to the saddle.

You only stopped when you felt Bran’s hands in your hair. You looked up at him and smiled.

You had no idea what he was going for but the touch didn’t bother you in the slightest.

“Bran?” you hummed, curious and somehow amused by his vested interest. “Yes Y/N” he grinned, still playing with your hair. He didn’t seem to want to stop and was getting too much joy out of tormenting you. “Let me help you out” you smiled, grabbing his much larger hand in your own.

You helped get him down from the saddle. You had gotten pretty good at helping him out, so it wasn’t all that bothersome.

You set him down on the soft blanket you had packet earlier. “Come here” he suggested, from where he was propped up. “What for?” you asked, washing your face in the river.

“Come here and sit with me” he groaned, trying his hardest  to be convincing. It was the most painful thing, not being able to chase you down. Every moment he spent with you was on your own accord.

You nodded, moving over to sit beside him. You stopped once you thought you were close enough but Bran had different ideas.

“Closer” He whispered “Bran-” you started but he stops you before you could refuse. “Come closer” he repeats pulling you into him before continuing to watch the birds.

The two of you sat for a few hours and eventually fell asleep. You both kept sitting until you felt a hand cover your mouth.

You  tried to yell out for Bran but couldn’t do it.

Not knowing what to do, you turned a knee into the man and he fell under the impact. Bran heard this and quickly stirred awake.

He jumped into action, grabbing his bow from his side and shot a single arrow into the mans jugular. You were quickly free from his grasp and back in Bran’s arms.

“Let’s go home” he suggested, after checking you over, and making sure you were okay.

-

During the night you couldn’t sleep. All you could think about was what had happened by the river with Bran.

You thought you should knock, but then decided against it in fear of waking the young prince.

You slowly opened the door and shivered again as the cold air hit you. As if the nightmares weren’t bad enough, now it was freezing beyond belief.

“Y/N” Bran’s voice echoed sleepily through the small room instantly forcing you to tense.  "Bran, I know it is improper for me to be here now, but I was freezing and the nightmares wouldn’t go away" you say shivering again and he only smiled at you.

“Well get over here” he ordered, pulling the thick fur blanket open for you and patting the space that was left.

“Are you sure?” you whispered, and he smiles again. “I’m sure, now get up here, before you freeze to death” he commands, opening his arms for you.

You laid down and wrapped the furs around your plump frame. Instantly you felt better. Bran’s bed was warm and much bigger than yours, plus the fear was already fading just by being close to him.

You turned to face Bran and sucked in a breath. He was much closer to you now than he’d ever been. “Come here” he repeated, sing the same phrase he had earlier that day. You let out a laugh at his antics “I can’t get any closer” you informed, giving him a giggle.

“Find a way”

In succession with his words, Bran wrapped his arms around you and pulled you close to his frame, holding you tight.

“Brandon” You huffed, he looked at you, expecting some sort of reprimand but instead he grinned. The sound of his real name leaving your lips caught his attention, in the best way possible.

“I think I love you” you whispered, catching him off guard. You cuddled into his neck, your arms around his neck.

Normally it would have been alarming to admit your love to someone but for you and Bran it was second nature. The two of you were engaged to be married soon enough, so it didn’t scare you at all.

He waited until you were sound asleep against his chest before answering you.  "I have and will always love you" he whispers, kissing your cheek and falling asleep.

reblog.comment:
Bran Stark x Plus size!reader

Word Count: 2061 words (Long) 

Warnings: none? 

Summary: A different take on how being betrothed to Bran would go. The two of you have been friends for quite some time. He has his accident and tries to shut her out but she won’t let her. 

———————————————————————————————————

[[MORE]]

You had just heard of the accident your dear friend had been in, and you were on your way to speak to him.

As soon as you opened the door to his chamber you were stopped by his mother Lady Catelyn.

“You, you did this to poor Bran” She yelled, instantly making you frown. “How milady? I was only riding with Sansa and Robb” you defend, but she scowled at you none-the-less.

Catelyn couldn’t stop her hatred for you, no matter how hard she tried. “I want you to leave” she spits with anger and hate in her eyes. “I’m sorry milady, I didn’t mean to anger you” You apologized, quickly hurrying out of the room. On your way, down the hall you rushed into Robb, and didn’t even realize until he had you by the wrist, keeping you from the ground.

Of course it was bothersome for you, to have earned nothing but Lady Catelyn’s aggression regardless of how hard you tried to make her like you. “Why are you in such a hurry for, aren’t you going to see Bran?” he asked, almost forcing you to burst into tears.

“Lady Catelyn wont let me see him, she says its my fault he is hurt ” You blubbered, normally you tried to save face but with something like Bran at stake, there was no way to do so.

“Hush now” Robb whispered, pulling you into him. “It’s not your fault” he assured, hugging you into his chest as he tried his hardest to soothe you.

“Its not your fault” he repeated over and over before letting you up. It was crazy to him that his mother was willing to make you feel so guilty about something out of your control. “Come now, stay behind me and we shall see him, just stay quiet” he suggests, wrapping you simply in his cloak before leading you down the hall toward Bran’s room.

“Mother” you heard Robb bellow, before hearing only a whimper from Catelyn in reply.

“He is dead, that’s all they say, he is dead” She cries and you wince at the word “He isn’t” Robb assures her. You took this moment to peak through the fabric of his cloak, almost breaking down at the sight of your broken friend.

“Why are you angry with Y/N” He asked, hiding your tense at his name. “This is her fault” she spit, shutting down his words without so much as a breath. You would have run for the hills if she spoke to you that way, but Robb didn’t falter. “This has nothing to do with her” he reminded, his voice strong and commanding as he headed toward the door, with you on his heels.

“She truly does hate me” You frowned, as soon as you stopped in the hall. Robb shook his head again “She is only hurt because she worries for him, don’t take it personally” he assured you, sending you off to find Arya.

If anyone was going to help you feel better after such a problem, it would be Arya.

-

Bran had woken a few weeks ago and you were hardly prepared for the news that his awakening would bring.

“He cannot walk” Jon had informed you and you nearly choked “He cant walk” you repeated, making sure you heard him right. Robb nodded, letting you know that the sick joke was the truth. “Can I speak to him?” your voice was slight, and careful as you implored the answer to both men. “I will take you, you shouldn’t go alone” Robb nodded, taking your hand.

There was a good chance that even after all this time, Catelyn hadn’t gotten over her upset and he wasn’t going to throw you to the wolves alone. “Will you come too Bran?” you ask, earning an odd look from him. You and Jon had never been the closest but you needed all the support you could get right now.

When you all finally got to Bran’s room, he was leaning on his bed side. “Bran” you muttered, your words falling from your lips in a gasp, throwing yourself from the two men and onto the bed.

“You’re alive” you yelled, hugging him roughly, avoiding his legs but holding him tight in your arms. “Barely” he groaned, shrugging away from you quickly. It wasn’t for the sake of you, but he was ashamed.

He was less of a man now. He wanted to marry you and build a strong home to raise your children in but who would want a cripple?

“Bran?” you questioned, his behavior was odd and put you on edge. “I can’t walk, I’m a cripple…useless, I’d rather be dead” He barked, instantly earning a gasp from you. How dare he say something like that? You’d been through so much over the last few months while he was unconscious, and now he felt inclined enough to say something so brash.

“Don’t ever say that Bran, you aren’t a cripple, you survived” you assured, running your hand over the side of his face, letting your touch relax him ever so slightly. You simply looking in his eyes, even though he didn’t want to look in yours. “Leave me” he ordered and you frowned, but stepped off the bed anyway, past Jon and Robb out the door.

You wanted to support Bran but it didn’t mean anything if he didn’t want you to. Even you knew that much.

“What are you doing?” Robb yells toward Bran, the boy only looked at him blankly. Robb turned quickly to follow you, leaving Jon and Bran all alone.

“Can I talk to you Bran?” Jon asked, sitting beside his brother on the bed. The boy nodded, giving his brother as much of his attention as he could. “Do you understand why Y/N is here?” he asked, starting the conversation of simply.

Bran shook his head.

“Well, when the time comes, you will marry her and she will live here in the north with you” he explained, his attention poised on his brother “So she isn’t my friend?” he countered, not completely understanding what you were going with.

Jon chuckled, Bran really had no idea what was going on “She is but she is more than that, she is to be your wife, your lady” finally, Bran nodded. He’d heard of people being betrothed before, but never did he think about you in that compacity.

It took a few moments for the information to sink in and once it did, Bran had a secondary question. “And I will love her?” his words caught Jon off guard but he smiled at the boy none-the-less.

YEARS AFTER:

You have been living in Westeros for years now, and had since learned of your betrothal to Bran and even looked forward to the day you would marry your best friend.

It had taken quite some time to grasp how many things had to be done differently now that Bran couldn’t use his legs. However, your love for him expanded even his paralysis.

You rushed through the woods as Bran followed on horseback-chasing you, a game you’d started years ago.

“You can’t get me” you taunted, as he laughed. “I’m your lord, address me of such” he ordered, still chuckling as his horse jaunted down the path.  "You cant get me, my lord" you added, rushing past the large tree until your foot caught a loose branch.

You fell to the ground in a heap and only looked up to see Bran laughing at you from atop his horse.

“Are you alright?” he asked, suddenly wishing he could only hop down from his horse and help you up, cursing his condition. “I’m fine” you assure, standing and brushing yourself off, walking over to the stream to wipe the mud off your face.

“Would you like to come down my lord?” you ask, earning a quick nod from him. You stood to the side of the horse and went to work on the latches that held Bran’s legs to the saddle.

You only stopped when you felt Bran’s hands in your hair. You looked up at him and smiled.

You had no idea what he was going for but the touch didn’t bother you in the slightest.

“Bran?” you hummed, curious and somehow amused by his vested interest. “Yes Y/N” he grinned, still playing with your hair. He didn’t seem to want to stop and was getting too much joy out of tormenting you. “Let me help you out” you smiled, grabbing his much larger hand in your own.

You helped get him down from the saddle. You had gotten pretty good at helping him out, so it wasn’t all that bothersome.

You set him down on the soft blanket you had packet earlier. “Come here” he suggested, from where he was propped up. “What for?” you asked, washing your face in the river.

“Come here and sit with me” he groaned, trying his hardest  to be convincing. It was the most painful thing, not being able to chase you down. Every moment he spent with you was on your own accord.

You nodded, moving over to sit beside him. You stopped once you thought you were close enough but Bran had different ideas.

“Closer” He whispered “Bran-” you started but he stops you before you could refuse. “Come closer” he repeats pulling you into him before continuing to watch the birds.

The two of you sat for a few hours and eventually fell asleep. You both kept sitting until you felt a hand cover your mouth.

You  tried to yell out for Bran but couldn’t do it.

Not knowing what to do, you turned a knee into the man and he fell under the impact. Bran heard this and quickly stirred awake.

He jumped into action, grabbing his bow from his side and shot a single arrow into the mans jugular. You were quickly free from his grasp and back in Bran’s arms.

“Let’s go home” he suggested, after checking you over, and making sure you were okay.

-

During the night you couldn’t sleep. All you could think about was what had happened by the river with Bran.

You thought you should knock, but then decided against it in fear of waking the young prince.

You slowly opened the door and shivered again as the cold air hit you. As if the nightmares weren’t bad enough, now it was freezing beyond belief.

“Y/N” Bran’s voice echoed sleepily through the small room instantly forcing you to tense.  "Bran, I know it is improper for me to be here now, but I was freezing and the nightmares wouldn’t go away" you say shivering again and he only smiled at you.

“Well get over here” he ordered, pulling the thick fur blanket open for you and patting the space that was left.

“Are you sure?” you whispered, and he smiles again. “I’m sure, now get up here, before you freeze to death” he commands, opening his arms for you.

You laid down and wrapped the furs around your plump frame. Instantly you felt better. Bran’s bed was warm and much bigger than yours, plus the fear was already fading just by being close to him.

You turned to face Bran and sucked in a breath. He was much closer to you now than he’d ever been. “Come here” he repeated, sing the same phrase he had earlier that day. You let out a laugh at his antics “I can’t get any closer” you informed, giving him a giggle.

“Find a way”

In succession with his words, Bran wrapped his arms around you and pulled you close to his frame, holding you tight.

“Brandon” You huffed, he looked at you, expecting some sort of reprimand but instead he grinned. The sound of his real name leaving your lips caught his attention, in the best way possible.

“I think I love you” you whispered, catching him off guard. You cuddled into his neck, your arms around his neck.

Normally it would have been alarming to admit your love to someone but for you and Bran it was second nature. The two of you were engaged to be married soon enough, so it didn’t scare you at all.

He waited until you were sound asleep against his chest before answering you.  "I have and will always love you" he whispers, kissing your cheek and falling asleep.

“Well, when the time comes, you will marry her and she will live here in the north with you” he explained, his attention poised on his brother “So she isn’t my friend?” he countered, not completely understanding what you were going with.

Jon chuckled, Bran really had no idea what was going on “She is but she is more than that, she is to be your wife, your lady” finally, Bran nodded. He’d heard of people being betrothed before, but never did he think about you in that compacity.

It took a few moments for the information to sink in and once it did, Bran had a secondary question. “And I will love her?” his words caught Jon off guard but he smiled at the boy none-the-less.

YEARS AFTER:

You have been living in Westeros for years now, and had since learned of your betrothal to Bran and even looked forward to the day you would marry your best friend.

It had taken quite some time to grasp how many things had to be done differently now that Bran couldn’t use his legs. However, your love for him expanded even his paralysis.

You rushed through the woods as Bran followed on horseback-chasing you, a game you’d started years ago.

“You can’t get me” you taunted, as he laughed. “I’m your lord, address me of such” he ordered, still chuckling as his horse jaunted down the path.  "You cant get me, my lord" you added, rushing past the large tree until your foot caught a loose branch.

You fell to the ground in a heap and only looked up to see Bran laughing at you from atop his horse.

“Are you alright?” he asked, suddenly wishing he could only hop down from his horse and help you up, cursing his condition. “I’m fine” you assure, standing and brushing yourself off, walking over to the stream to wipe the mud off your face.

“Would you like to come down my lord?” you ask, earning a quick nod from him. You stood to the side of the horse and went to work on the latches that held Bran’s legs to the saddle.

You only stopped when you felt Bran’s hands in your hair. You looked up at him and smiled.

You had no idea what he was going for but the touch didn’t bother you in the slightest.

“Bran?” you hummed, curious and somehow amused by his vested interest. “Yes Y/N” he grinned, still playing with your hair. He didn’t seem to want to stop and was getting too much joy out of tormenting you. “Let me help you out” you smiled, grabbing his much larger hand in your own.

You helped get him down from the saddle. You had gotten pretty good at helping him out, so it wasn’t all that bothersome.

You set him down on the soft blanket you had packet earlier. “Come here” he suggested, from where he was propped up. “What for?” you asked, washing your face in the river.

“Come here and sit with me” he groaned, trying his hardest  to be convincing. It was the most painful thing, not being able to chase you down. Every moment he spent with you was on your own accord.

You nodded, moving over to sit beside him. You stopped once you thought you were close enough but Bran had different ideas.

“Closer” He whispered “Bran-” you started but he stops you before you could refuse. “Come closer” he repeats pulling you into him before continuing to watch the birds.

The two of you sat for a few hours and eventually fell asleep. You both kept sitting until you felt a hand cover your mouth.

You  tried to yell out for Bran but couldn’t do it.

Not knowing what to do, you turned a knee into the man and he fell under the impact. Bran heard this and quickly stirred awake.

He jumped into action, grabbing his bow from his side and shot a single arrow into the mans jugular. You were quickly free from his grasp and back in Bran’s arms.

“Let’s go home” he suggested, after checking you over, and making sure you were okay.

-

During the night you couldn’t sleep. All you could think about was what had happened by the river with Bran.

You thought you should knock, but then decided against it in fear of waking the young prince.

You slowly opened the door and shivered again as the cold air hit you. As if the nightmares weren’t bad enough, now it was freezing beyond belief.

“Y/N” Bran’s voice echoed sleepily through the small room instantly forcing you to tense.  "Bran, I know it is improper for me to be here now, but I was freezing and the nightmares wouldn’t go away" you say shivering again and he only smiled at you.

“Well get over here” he ordered, pulling the thick fur blanket open for you and patting the space that was left.

“Are you sure?” you whispered, and he smiles again. “I’m sure, now get up here, before you freeze to death” he commands, opening his arms for you.

You laid down and wrapped the furs around your plump frame. Instantly you felt better. Bran’s bed was warm and much bigger than yours, plus the fear was already fading just by being close to him.

You turned to face Bran and sucked in a breath. He was much closer to you now than he’d ever been. “Come here” he repeated, sing the same phrase he had earlier that day. You let out a laugh at his antics “I can’t get any closer” you informed, giving him a giggle.

“Find a way”

In succession with his words, Bran wrapped his arms around you and pulled you close to his frame, holding you tight.

“Brandon” You huffed, he looked at you, expecting some sort of reprimand but instead he grinned. The sound of his real name leaving your lips caught his attention, in the best way possible.

“I think I love you” you whispered, catching him off guard. You cuddled into his neck, your arms around his neck.

Normally it would have been alarming to admit your love to someone but for you and Bran it was second nature. The two of you were engaged to be married soon enough, so it didn’t scare you at all.

He waited until you were sound asleep against his chest before answering you.  "I have and will always love you" he whispers, kissing your cheek and falling asleep.
trail.content_abstract:
Bran Stark x Plus size!reader

Word Count: 2061 words (Long) 

Warnings: none? 

Summary: A different take on how being betrothed to Bran would go. The two of you have been friends for quite some time. He has his accident and tries to shut her out but she won’t let her.
